alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Floyd and central Pike Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 912 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coal Run, or near Pikeville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shelbiana around 920 PM EDT. Zebulon, Chloe and Garden Village around 925 PM EDT. Raccoon and Meta around 930 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kimper, Fishtrap Lake, Sidney, Phyllis, Canada, Mcandrews, Huddy and Belfry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
